Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: What an entrance gate
Review: This is a gate with excellent architecture wherein from one side there are three stories and from the other side it is a single story. The architecture and motifs are pleasing and remind of Awadh architecture and intellect.

Name: DBG_Aprl
Title: Magnificent Architecture
Review: It's a magnificent and royal architecture of its kind. Very wide. Located next to Bara imambara. No tickets. Easily accessible by auto.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Majestic monument
Review: The Rumi Darwaza stands in between the Bara Imambara and the Chota Imambara. It is an impressive structure and derives its architecture from Turkish influence. The motifs on the arch have Chikankari design, and pan leaves & fruits, that were the choice of the Nawabs in those days.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Must Watch at Hussainabad Heritage Zone
Review: Standing at 60 Ft, midway between Bada & Chhota Imambara, built in 1784 by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daulah this imposing structure marks the entrance to the old city of Lucknow... designed after the Imperial Gate or Bâb-ı Hümâyûn at the Topkapi Castle of Istanbul is also an example of Awadhi school of architecture

Name: debarshid73
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: If you are standing in front Bara Imambara facing towards it, Rumi Darwaza will be on your right side. This massive structure used to be the entrance of old Lucknow city. It is  located in between Bara Imambara and Chota Imambara, so if you moving towards Choto Imambara from Bara Imambara you need to pass through Rumi Darwaza.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Beautiful darwaza
Review: Roomi darwaza is situated at about 5-7 minutes walking distance from Bara Imambara towards chota Imambara. If we have to visit Ghana ghar, picture gallery and chota Imambara from bara Imambara we have to pass through roomi darwaza.       This is a beautiful gate for clicking pictures. Many vehicles ass through this gate.         A beautiful darwaza in Lucknow.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Nice Monumnet
Review: Again as with different monuments of Lucknow, I found this also to be a great monument. However, I am not sure if any body is looking towards its maintenance.  Must visit for first time visitors to Lucknow.

Name: Shveta S
Title: Old&, beautiful
Review: Beautiful darwaza, with intricate work. Be careful of guides around coz not required as such.its close to bada Imambara. Bada Imambara was closed  on Friday till 3pm.sobplan accordingly.

Name: Aman J
Title: elegance of old lucknow.
Review: Rumi Gate is one of the old Lucknow entrances and is still in great shape.Some restoration work is underway.Its a nice drive through moving from Bara Imambara to Small one

Name: Rakesh K
Title: What a darwaza
Review: Ancient history galore is Lucknows forte and this is one place to be seen and felt the glory and the labor involved to build it.

Name: DrKlair
Title: Wonderful unique architectue
Review: Just adjacent to the Bara Imambara is this imposing five story high gate .It has different styles on both side .Beautiful place to click pictures

Name: JoyBose
Title: Its an amazing piece of architecture, from any angle
Review: It was built by the nawabs of Lucknow, it is situated in Chowk area of old Lucknow, walking distance from the imambara. It is a huge gate, climbing it is not possible but one can view from outside. Its beauty is phenomenal from any angle and at any time of day.

Name: Ajeet
Title: One of Identities of Awadh
Review: A very beautiful Awadhi architecture masterpiece, certainly Lucknow’s most photographed place. However this structure needs good maintenance to keep its glory.

Name: R1chardN
Title: A grand gateway
Review: This grand gateway has beautiful architecture and is the entry point to the city.  It's size is impressive and there seems to be a marked difference in the atmosphere on the two sides of the gate.We walked with our guide from inside the city though the gateway to the outside - it is quite exceptional.  On the inside, of course, you will be greeted by the numerous horse pulled carriages where you can buy a guided city tour.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Architechtural landmark, the USP of lucknow
Review: The very good place comes under the heritage zone of Lucknow. very lively in the evening time. A must-see.

Name: Saif Khan
Title: Awesome
Review: Rumi darwaza is one of the famous darwaza and one of the best darwaza beautiful must watch this ek khawat hai jise na Da maula usa de ashf ud daulah

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: Rumi Darwaza is a very good place to visit atleast once. The architecture is wonderful and should be visited.

Name: Mitesh
Title: Door
Review: Rumi Darwaza in the heart of Lucknow looms over the busy everyday traffic of Lajpatnagar. It is very famous among all of ages

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Marvellous
Review: Located on through fare  near Imambaras  this is a great photo opportunity place with much to see .Superb architecture .

Name: Anuradha
Title: Old world charm
Review: A symbol of Lucknow! A gateway made in a beautiful Awadhi style is a must visit place when you are in Lucknow. Situated in between Bada Imambara and Chhota Imambara, it takes you to 19 th century charm. If you have affinity for old culture you will live this place.

Name: Pawan S
Title: SYMBOL OF NAWAB
Review: A good example of fine architecture of Nawab empire Mixed style architecture of mughal and European And standing with its own style

Name: niya27
Title: Big Gate
Review: This is a big gate near bada imambada. The structure was magnificent. The gate is on the road. There is traffic going through this gate.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Good
Review: Rumi darwaja is beautiful . It was huge and my kids also liked it . There was huge traffic there . Never saw such huge and beautiful darwaja ...

Name: engineertripster
Title: It's a huge gate
Review: We visited this along a list of other attractions when we landed at Bada Imambara. The private guides out there will take you along a 1.5 km journey from Rumi Gate, to Clock Tower and over the Gomti river front. They will say they are taking you to show how Chikan(embroidery) is done, but they will just take you to a shop, which sells finished goods.The Rumi Gate is huge - the front and back designs are completely different. You'll find many vehicles stopped on the side, with groups of friends taking photos.

Name: David
Title: Old Gate
Review: Lukhnow has too many Mugal darwaja like this. We passed many times through Rumi Darwaja, not noticed it because you see several of them around bada imamabara.

Name: Chandra P
Title: Magnificent
Review: The Rumi is part of the gigantic palace complex of the rulers of old. The architecture is stunning and the scope and scale overwhelming. It is well worth seeing.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Gate in the middle of the road…
Review: Rumi Darwaza is one off the iconic attractions of Lucknow. It is an intricately carved door which is right in the middle of the road and has traffic going across it.

Name: chikpick
Title: A short visit to feel the history
Review: Grand gate built with an impressive architecture. Winters are a perfect time to visit. Nearby is immambara. Also tonga ride is a good experience. Quite clean and broad way it is and gives a glimpse of old lucknow. Nearby there are lot of chickenkari shops but don't try those as they tend to sell some cheap stuff.

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Very famous landmark
Review: This is very famous landmark in Lucknow. It is famous for its architecture. Good for first time visitors. Well cleaned and maintained place.

Name: TJRDunne
Title: Stunning, but hard to get a close look at
Review: The Rumi gate is still in use and the road is busy and active. Unless you go at dawn its hard to get a close look at it. It is stunning

Name: Ani397
Title: Just a gate
Review: Nothing so special about this place just a gateway designed in Mughal architecture..You can have few clicks near the gate and also the clock tower is nearby ..I would like to mention here that the auto driver outside the gate will purposely drag you to a few textile shop which they are commissioned from..

Name: rogerl044
Title: Impressive gate
Review: You can only drive through and stop the car long enough to take pictures and appreciate what it must have been like to enter the city through it. It is impressive enough nowadays

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Exciting
Review: From the Bara Imambara, we hopped onto a tanga, & made our way to the Rumi Darwaza. Our excitement was doubled with our first horse carriage ride & the grand gateway ahead of us.The Rumi Darwaza is a gateway built under the patronage of the same Nawab & in the same year as the Bara Imambara. The front facade is a fine, fine example of Awadhi architecture!As it's an operational gateway, you've to be careful of traffic. There's no ticket to see the Rumi Darwaza.

Name: pemmireddy
Title: Good to see
Review: Worth the visit ... no fees as the traffic drives through it. Get a local tour guide to give you the background info

Name: SunnyandBuster
Title: Impressive in size
Review: This is the great ornamental gate of the Bara Imambara. The scale is impressive and there is much to explore. The whole architectural group here includes a huge mosque. No cameras allowed when we visited and a head scarf was not required.

Name: Shardul Bahuguna
Title: One for the history buffs
Review: This is a huge monument right next to the Bara Imambara. You can walk to the mammoth gate. no tickets, not gates. Traffic uses the gate so you need to hop on and off the road a bit. The structure is humongous and beautiful. For history buffs, there enough to read and learn about the place, but for a regular tourist it may not amount to much except for a few pictures.

Name: Dev Marwaha
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Roomi gate built in 1784 is one of the most peaceful architecture in lucknow and is now used as the symbol for city of NAWABS.It used to mark the entrance to Old Lucknow City, but as the City of Nawabs grew and expanded, it was later used as an entrance to a palace which was later demolished by the British insurgents.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Historic
Review: Ancient place of historic importance. Architecture is good and it’s part of heritage of the city of Lucknow. Take a few snaps there and move on. Nothing much special for common people but for history lovers it’s important place.

Name: Manava
Title: Simple
Review: This is one bigish gate... it is ornate and stands between Bara Imambara and Chota Imambara. It is a 5 min visit only.  You dont need any ticket or anything to see it. The place is of historic value. But basic and simple. Lots of cycle rikshaws hurdle around here.

Name: Kdue2
Title: Beautiful
Review: You can walk from Chota Imambara via Rumi Gate to Bara Imambara. It has too many cars parked in front but it is a beautiful gate.

Name: taotzu
Title: Outstanding City gate
Review: This is a very outstanding City gate loading to bara imambara. The  promenade with cobbled streets leadings in to the old city before this gate is amazingly colonial reminding us of European City. Great.

Name: Rajjat Sabhrwal
Title: You should once visit to witness this
Review: I must say that if you are in Lucknow, you should once visit this place to see its architecture, it’s really nice if you know a little bit about this place. This was actually built in 1784 - 86, it has approx 69 feet entrance and looks really great once you cross this.. many vehicles go it from this gate as its in in the middle of the road.. also people say that there is no visible support to this high entrance.. make sure you also pass this gate..

Name: prakharsingh
Title: great
Review: my experience was great, i roamed all around the area which was surrounded with epic things. lovable place to shop for cheap and ethnic stuffs.

Name: tickettoamoment
Title: Great art work
Review: This gate defines the beauty of mughal times. If we see this design up side down it looks like chicken work. Which is one of the famous design of Lucknow. Great source of income during mughal empire.

Name: Indieopus
Title: Was expecting more but it's fine!
Review: This is a specially made Darwaza or door on the main road which is no more a spot to stand and click photos or do something there, you can pass through the door as that's the only road for all the vehicles to pass through! Could have made a podium or something to click photos !

Name: Jatin Lamba
Title: Iconic and landmark gateway
Review: Rumi Darwaza is an architectural marvel and an iconic landmark gateway of the city of Lucknow.  This was built by Nawab Asaf-Ud-daula during the late 18th century.  There was severe drought conditions for several years in Lucknow during those days and to help the people earn money, the Nawab decided to built this iconic structure.  11 years' period was consumed in building this gateway.  In order to let people continue to earn livelihood, the Nawab used to get construction works done during day time and destruction partially during the night hours so that maximum period is consumed and help in the form of wages can be accorded for the betterment of the public at large.  It is a huge structure and traffic pass through this.  It is adjacent to the Bada Imambara.

Name: durham05
Title: Impressive
Review: The impressive mughal gate is certainly worth checking out and there are many other historic Islamic buildings in the surrounding area.

Name: Shyam S
Title: Place eflects Nawabi Architecture and beautiful work
Review: Its transit for small vehicles, yet its must visit. Best if you can step out and behold ancient beauty.

Name: 982pradipb
Title: A Hurried Trip
Review: The Darwaja is located next to the Bara Imambara. It presents different views from the front and the back . The area around is not well maintained. A road passes through it .

Name: Mayank S
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: It's a beautifully built door on the middle of the road and seemed nice to drive through it. The road is extremely wide and we'll maintained. I would suggest you to avoid the private guides who'll just not stop following you and would give inaccurate facts about this place. It's better you visit this place without one. The private guides here are a scam.

Name: apul_goel
Title: Rumi darwaza: the symbol of Lucknow!
Review: Standing gracefully near the Bara Imambara, the Rumi darwaza, has a unique architecture. Give some time to appreciate its beauty!

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: GATEWAY OF LUCKNOW
Review: Its really amazing and very huge. Its looking like RAJ MAHAL. Nice to see this beautiful historical place.

Name: S P S
Title: Gateway to enter Imambara
Review: See the art and architecture of the building, mehrabs, stone used to built the gate.  It has three gates with such heights through which trucks could drive easily.

Name: Asim A
Title: Beautiful.
Review: After completing a great tour of Bara Imambara my cousins took me to the Museum and on the way there we went through this beautiful historical gate.  It was a treat to see this beautiful gate and learning the history.

Name: Naveen
Title: Nice Architecture but requires cleaning of surrounding area
Review: Nice Architecture but towards chota imam bara and chants Ghar it becomes a toilet , place requires cleaning and traffic control

Name: rajesh
Title: lucknows best example of avadhi architecture
Review: its one of the best example of awadhi architecture and is easily related to the name of  lucknow.a must visit

Name: Bharat K
Title: Magnificent structure, good to see from a distance
Review: Located between the Clock Tower and the Bara Imambara, it is architecturally beautiful.You can get a good view while walking or driving past from the Clock Tower to the Bara Imambara or vice versa.Do stop and have a good look to appreciate the architecture. It is a 2 minute attraction, and is also visible from the Clock Tower and from the Bara Imambara.The traffic is very chaotic and heavy in the evenings from 5 pm, and finding a parking spot is difficult.

Name: Dr. Rohit Mody Cardiologist Mumbai
Title: Good experience
Review: Nice place to visit. Place is near Bada Imambara. Many other places. Clock Tower and Chicken Cloth Factory, Nimbu Park is good places to visit. Darwaja is historically and artistically very important landmark. This darwaza has been filmed for Film Gaddar and shown as Lahore Gate. This information given to us by Guide.

Name: GoPlaces65661648539
Title: Stately and Peaceful
Review: Our visit was truly enjoyable because of the peaceful and serene setting that punctuated the backdrop

Name: ASHISH V
Title: Must place to visit in lucknow.
Review: Its one of the historical monument of Lucknow. A must visit place if you are planning to visits Lucknow.

Name: rajivtyagi
Title: RumI
Review: Made to mark respect for famous persian poet Rumi. This is a faboulous structure with differen designs on both sides. An iconic structure in lucknow. This is located just next to Bara Imambara.

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Magnificent
Review: One of the most beautiful gates,I have come across, very impressive considering when it was built, still a bustling part of town.

Name: Janaki Visvanath
Title: Majestic
Review: What a view! It's majestic, standing right in the middle of the road! With traffic all around, it stands tall to the Shia traditions of Lucknow

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: darwaza
Review: a historical place made in 1784 by the nawab of lucknow . beautiful piece of architecture and one of the famous historical place in lucknow . famous gateway to lucknow and famous tourist spot

Name: Lbs123
Title: must visit place
Review: very beautifully design gate from one side its looks like three story building on otherside its looks like one story, if you look gate upside down its famous embroidery for most of lucknowie kurtas.

Name: Sharil I
Title: An insight into the heart of Lucknow
Review: This place has an environmental benefit rather than anything. Here you can learn the historical legacy of the city while visiting to different parks and sit thrus that give you peace and relaxation.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Classical Architecture
Review: Just near the Imambara. Once it was the entry point to Lucknow. Prefer to see it in late evening when illuminated by lights.

Name: FATBOY
Title: RUMI DARWAZA
Review: Rumi Darwaza,Built by Nawab Asaf us daula in 1784, is a historical monument near Bada ImamBada, Lucknow. Takes you back in time showing the brilliance of awadhi architecture. It has a big lantern on top of it which lights this monument at night. Definitely a place to visit in Lucknow.

Name: Puja_deb
Title: Sightseeing
Review: Rumi Darwaza is located in front of Bada Imambada. Nice place to click some photos. The architecture is different from both sides

Name: Krupabn
Title: Gateway which is like 2 sides of coin
Review: Gateway has intricate designs carved in it.. Both sides of the gateway are different.. Iconic landmark of Lucknow.. Premises is not maintained well but worth a visit.

Name: keith h
Title: Iconic Victory Arch.
Review: The Arch is synonomous with Lucknow & is modelled on one of Istanbul's gates to Asia Minor. It was constructed under the auspices of Nawab Asaf-ud-daula 7 straddles the road neat the Bara Imambara. As well as being of massive dimensions it is host to some beautiful carvings.

Name: Sweetbunnycute
Title: Beautiful gate
Review: Rumi Darwaza is a beautiful gate built by the Nawab of Lucknow. It is designed in such a way that it looks like a 3-4 storey building from one side and once you cross the gate and look around. The view is completely different. You see a single huge gate with such beautiful carvings. It is a real delight for one’s eyes.

Name: Praveen Singh
Title: Landmark of Lucknow
Review: This is considered to be a landmark of Lucknow and is located right close to the bada Imambara. Basically it's also forms a part of local Road in Lucknow. Many historical places are within a kilometre  around

Name: Vaibhav Bakhshi
Title: A well suited identity for Lucknow
Review: This Turkish gate, built under the patronage of Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula stands as the identity of Lucknow city. It provides a fitting entrance to the palacial complex of the Nawabs. It was designed in Turkey and has been named after a Muslim sufi saint, Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Rumi. I personally have a lot of appreciation for the grandeur of this gate. With the recent renovations in the area, this gate is now accessible from all sides and there is an open sit-out area next to it which allows the visitors to enjoy this place in the evenings.

Name: nikrang
Title: The great Gate
Review: Very fine example of the old style. And looks awsome as it spans that main thorough fare. Well preserved

Name: Ajeet N
Title: Door of benevolence
Review: Constructed by the nawab to give labour to his people during a famine. Both it's facades are different. On one side are 3 orifices while on the other is the famous single door.Made with lentil as one of the ingredients, it also has clove replicas all over the structure.

Name: Akriti G G
Title: Its simply beautiful!
Review: we drove past this both during the day and night and it is simply magnificent! loved the detailing and architecture! it has a lovely charm to itself.

Name: Anupriya S
Title: Imposing Gateway
Review: Rumi Darwaza is a magnificent sample of awadhi architecture. It was built under the patronage of the nawab of awadh. A must visit.

Name: Huzefa
Title: Grand indeed
Review: Very grand... especially if you can imagine a train of elephants and mounted soldiers entering the city in old history... a must stop by

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good place
Review: Lucknow's wisdom and culture are unmatched. Rumi darwaze is one of the most satisfying places I have visited. Garden surrounding this monument are clean. It always makes me peace when I spend a couple of hours here.

Name: BloggersWithoutBorders
Title: Historical Architecture
Review: It's an road which leads to Imambara and Ghantaghar. It looks amazing but it is not maintained well. There is visiting charges but reaching early will help you to click some amazing pictures. If you are visiting Imambara and driving your own car you get parking at Rumi Darwaza. You can also hire a horse ride to take a spin around near by places and charges are very minimal.

Name: Ratish J
Title: Poor Maintenance
Review: Although the gate is majestic but it needs urgent attention. The thoroughfare should be out of bound for cars and bikes.It is well known structure at Bada Imambada and can be seen in many movies shot at Lucknow.

Name: Sightsee611662
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: Breathtaking beauty but amidst a busy roadside . Have to be careful regarding the traffic especially during rush hours

Name: Rahul r
Title: Great historical palce
Review: It's a great historical place in Lucknow. I enjoyed here with family and friends. Highly recommended for weakened holiday.

Name: Bee143
Title: Beautiful but requires maintenance...
Review: Located just outside of Bara Imambara in Old Lucknow...this area is definately worth visiting to appreciate the beautiful architecture.

Name: Manas R
Title: Unforgettable
Review: At times when the sun is not scorching, preferably around dawn or dusk, you would simply love to stare at the architecture, ignoring surrounding crowd or traffic.

Name: lalani_13
Title: Hugh entrance !
Review: we passed there in our car+driver+guide as part of our tour and we took some photos but did not get down.

Name: kondu
Title: Gate with a difference.
Review: It is just 10 minutes to see this darwaza the gate. on one side it is mohamedian aechitecture and from other side it is indian. it is a mere entry ans exit gate constructed in unison. even after three centuries they stand tall. worth viewing.

Name: Mousumee M
Title: Mughal Architecture
Review: It is close to Bara Imambara of Lucknow. A huge gate of about 60 ft height. As we got down from the local autorickshaw, a young guide approached us for a guided tour of Rumi Darwaza,Clock Tower  and Shahi Bawli. It was a short distance covered by a battery run small auto rickshaw. All these three huge architectural beauties reminds us about the rich nawabi heritages of old Lucknow. Somehow people go back to the history...the olden times.

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Just another GAte
Review: Only if ur local guise creates interest by the history of the architecture of the gate, it will create a buzz, else it is just another pass way to the imamabra in old city.

Name: Megha
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: You can travel on e rickshaw and visit all sites nearby but please beware of guides of rickshaw drivers who want you to divert from your plan and take you to particular shop of lakhnawi clothes.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: If you are visiting Lucknow and want to witness the epitome of Awadh architecture, then this place should be on your bucket list.

Name: Hads3g
Title: Iconic Awadhi architecture
Review: This darwaza is a symbol of Awadhi/ Nababi architechture which is a perfect blend of different kind of styles.

Name: Abhinav D
Title: Must visit for anyone visiting Lucknow
Review: Its the city's culture, heritage which is truly visible when you visit this part of the city !You will also be getting a variety of cuisines here which nowhere else is available in lucknow ! A few of the items not to miss in chowk are the famous Biryani, Shree Lassi ke Chole Bature, Raja ki Thandai , Aam ki kheer ,Radhey lal's sweets & makkhan malai.

Name: Mital_Ashish
Title: Must visit - see the photos
Review: must visit - beautiful, lovely architecture though not well maintained or preserved. Tourism and Archaeology go hand in hand - need to preserve and showcase our monuments and culture

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: historic
Review: this is the entry gate of bara imambara and bhul bhulaiyya. the structure is maintained very well. good place to take photos.

Name: indrajit1405
Title: evolution of the kurta neck designs
Review: the entire gate when seen upside down it shows how the neck designs of the kurtas started. its just a gate in the heritage area of Lucknow next to the Bara and Chota imambaras

Name: MoushumiBhattacharya
Title: Designed as inverted Naulakha Haar!
Review: Rumi Gate is made in the design of a Naulakha haar, inverted. Also designed like the Lucknow famous Chikankari embroidery work. Very close to Bara Imambara, it has a beautiful setting to see the city passing by the gate. From one end, you can see the four stories of the architect whereas from the other end, it is the only one piece. A true marvel.

Name: rajivdst
Title: Classic Arch gate
Review: Rumi Darwaja is part of the complex housing Bada Imambara and Chhota Imambara and on the passage from one to the other. It had one main arch and two side arches, meant for passage of elephants and horses during the Nawab rulers.

Name: Demétrio S
Title: Must see
Review: There is nothing special, but if you are already in Lucknow, you must see it. Crazy traffic and massive people....
